name: collegiately
content:
collegiately adverb
(IN COLLEGE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates or belongs to a college or its students : These young people have a lot ahead of them if they decide to compete either collegiately or professionally. Collegiately, I played with a number of guys who are now professionals.
More examplesFewer examplesHe played regularly at the local country club, then collegiately at North Carolina State. There was a shortage of collegiately trained teachers.

collegiately adverb
(FRIENDLY)
formal in a way that involves or shows friendly and helpful relationships between colleagues (= people who work together): Organizations that are already working collegiately could form a separate group to work with government in the development of policy. Decisions were taken collegiately, so if any of the directors objected to a proposal, it was rejected. Synonym
collegially
